alert.note: Alert for Central Blue Mountains; Northern Blue Mountains of Oregon; Wallowa District (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pendleton (Northeast Oregon and Southeast Washington)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued August 21 at 2:24PM PDT until August 22 at 8:00PM PDT by NWS Pendleton
info.description: ...ISOLATED TO SCATTERED THUNDERSTORMS EXPECTED ACROSS EASTERN PORTIONS OF THE AREA TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY AFTERNOON... .A disturbance crossing the area tonight is expected to result in isolated thunderstorms overnight becoming scattered in the eastern mountain zones during the day on Monday. Abundant lightning is expected over the Blue Mountains and Wallowa County. Most other portions of the area can expect isolated thunderstorms. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 8 PM THIS EVENING TO 8 PM PDT MONDAY FOR ABUNDANT LIGHTNING FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES OR643, OR644, OR645, WA692, AND WA693... The National Weather Service in Pendleton has issued a Red Flag Warning for abundant lightning, which is in effect from 8 PM this evening to 8 PM PDT Monday. The Fire Weather Watch is no longer in effect. * AFFECTED AREA...Fire Weather Zones 643 Northern Blue Mountains of Oregon, 644 Central Blue Mountains, 645 Wallowa District, 692 Blue Mountains of Washington and 693 Southeast Washington Grande Ronde Valley. * IMPACTS...Lightning strikes may create new fire starts. * THUNDERSTORMS...Storms will be possible tonight from the Ochoco- John Day Highland northward into the Blue Mountains and Wallowa County. Isolated storms overnight are expected to become scattered tomorrow morning and afternoon. Individual cells may have wetting rains but most are expected to have just a few hundredths of an inch. Additionally, lightning may strike in dry areas away from the showers with these storms. * OUTFLOW WINDS...Erratic winds to 40 mph will be possible with these storms.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now....or will shortly. A combination of strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.

area.areaDesc: Central Blue Mountains; Northern Blue Mountains of Oregon; Wallowa District
